title: Basic restatis Workflow
text: vignette describes basic workflow finding, exploring, retrieving data GENESIS API using restatis. scenario vignette, going researcher trying find data income bus drivers, called “Busfahrer”.

title: Basic restatis Workflow
text: First, can explore keyword represented GENESIS database. want see keywords related way words, need precise search process; case already particular keyword, related keywords included search expand data collection. broad possible, want search term database contains keyword. , can use “*” wildcard beginning end search term: Based results, original keyword “busfahrer” already specific enough, additional specifications necessary. started keyword “bus” - vehicle - can see database several related terms might helpful narrow search radius . example, might helpful see least three different types buses searchable: “fernbus”, “schienenbus” “kraftomnibusse”.
code: gen_alternative_terms(term = "*busfahrer*") #> $Output #> [1] "busfahrer" #>  #> attr(,"Term") #> [1] "*busfahrer*" #> attr(,"Language") #> [1] "de" #> attr(,"Pagelength") #> [1] "100" #> attr(,"Copyright") #> [1] "© Statistisches Bundesamt (Destatis), 2023" gen_alternative_terms(term = "*bus*") #> $Output #>  [1] "Bus"                  "bus"                  "busin"                #>  [4] "Busse"                "busse"                "bambus"               #>  [7] "bussen"               "büsche"               "cottbus"              #> [10] "fernbus"              "a.bambus"             "aubussons"            #> [13] "business"             "jadebusen"            "busfahrer"            #> [16] "busin.and"            "bambusmöbel"          "bambuswaren"          #> [19] "bustickets"           "f.omnibusse"          "buschbohnen"          #> [22] "kraftomnibus"         "bambussprossen"       "büstenhalter"         #> [25] "kraftomnibusse"       "businessschool"       "freilandbüsche"       #> [28] "busin.sch.berlin"     "doppellumentubus"     "bambusflechtstoffen"  #> [31] "flugticket, business" "business-class-tarif" #>  [ reached getOption("max.print") -- omitted 68 entries ] #>  #> attr(,"Term") #> [1] "*bus*" #> attr(,"Language") #> [1] "de" #> attr(,"Pagelength") #> [1] "100" #> attr(,"Copyright") #> [1] "© Statistisches Bundesamt (Destatis), 2023"

title: Basic restatis Workflow
text: Now specific keyword search, can search database exactly term. want results ordered items title includes search term top. also want explore object types now: can see find results keyword “busfahrer” category objects (statistics, tables, variables, cubes). Based promising content description first cube object, next step check contains requesting data. side note, functions package return objects additional attributes represent parameters additional information GENESIS API query. check attributes ever need help recognising got output.
code: search_results <- gen_find(   term = "busfahrer",   detailed = FALSE,   ordering = TRUE,   category = "all" ) #> Use 'detailed = TRUE' to obtain the complete output.  search_results #> $Tables #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   Code       Content                                                        Object_Type #>   <chr>      <chr>                                                          <chr>       #> 1 62361-0030 Bruttostundenverdienste, Bruttomonatsverdienste: Deutschland,… Table       #> 2 62361-0034 Bruttojahresverdienste: Deutschland, Jahre, Geschlecht, Berufe Table       #>  #> $Statistics #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   Code  Content           Object_Type #>   <chr> <chr>             <chr>       #> 1 62361 Verdiensterhebung Statistic   #>  #> $Variables #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   Code   Content                             Object_Type #>   <chr>  <chr>                               <chr>       #> 1 KB10A5 Berufsgattungen (KB2010), 5-Steller Variable    #>  #> $Cubes #> # A tibble: 4 × 3 #>   Code       Content                                                        Object_Type #>   <chr>      <chr>                                                          <chr>       #> 1 62361BJ013 Verdiensterhebung, Durchschn. Bruttostundenverdienste ohne So… Cube        #> 2 62361BJ010 Verdiensterhebung, Durchschn. Bruttostundenverdienste ohne So… Cube        #> 3 62361BJ019 Verdiensterhebung, Durchschn. Bruttojahresverdienste inkl. So… Cube        #> 4 62361BJ016 Verdiensterhebung, Durchschn. Bruttojahresverdienste inkl. So… Cube        #>  #> attr(,"Term") #> [1] "busfahrer" #> attr(,"Language") #> [1] "de" #> attr(,"Pagelength") #> [1] "100" #> attr(,"Copyright") #> [1] "© Statistisches Bundesamt (Destatis), 2023"

title: Basic restatis Workflow
text: check whether GENESIS data objects relevant interest, obtain metadata objects requesting data . metadata type object stores different key characteristics help understand object . question income bus drivers, want check metadata first cube object got find function:
code: gen_metadata(   code = search_results$Cubes$Code[1],   category = search_results$Cubes$Object_Type[1] ) #> Error in gen_metadata(code = search_results$Cubes$Code[1], category = search_results$Cubes$Object_Type[1]): could not find function "gen_metadata"

title: Basic restatis Workflow
text: now pretty sure cube object help us find information research question. next step get data GENESIS API. Based fact want cube object, now use gen_cube() function. GENESIS object types, use corresponding functions (e.g., gen_table() tables). Important note: possible get whole GENESIS statistic object, possible collect different related cube objects independently try recombine . TODO: Create helpers decipher column names.
code: gen_cube(search_results$Cubes$Code[1]) #> # A tibble: 2,508 × 20 #>    DINSG GES   KB10A5     SMONAT  VST045_WERT VST045_QUALITAET VST045_GESPERRT #>  * <chr> <chr> <chr>      <chr>         <dbl> <chr>            <lgl>           #>  1 DG    GESM  KB10-01104 04/2022        31.3 e                NA              #>  2 DG    GESM  KB10-01203 04/2022        21.6 e                NA              #>  3 DG    GESM  KB10-01302 04/2022        17.4 e                NA              #>  4 DG    GESM  KB10-01402 04/2022        15.3 e                NA              #>  5 DG    GESM  KB10-11101 04/2022        12.8 e                NA              #>  6 DG    GESM  KB10-11102 04/2022        13.7 e                NA              #>  7 DG    GESM  KB10-11103 04/2022        23.6 ()               NA              #>  8 DG    GESM  KB10-11104 04/2022        30.8 e                NA              #>  9 DG    GESM  KB10-11113 04/2022        21.4 ()               NA              #> 10 DG    GESM  KB10-11114 04/2022         0   /                NA              #> # ℹ 2,498 more rows #> # ℹ 13 more variables: `VST045_WERT-VERFAELSCHT` <dbl>, VST047_WERT <dbl>, #> #   VST047_QUALITAET <chr>, VST047_GESPERRT <lgl>, `VST047_WERT-VERFAELSCHT` <dbl>, #> #   VST051_WERT <dbl>, VST051_QUALITAET <chr>, VST051_GESPERRT <lgl>, #> #   `VST051_WERT-VERFAELSCHT` <dbl>, VST052_WERT <dbl>, VST052_QUALITAET <chr>, #> #   VST052_GESPERRT <lgl>, `VST052_WERT-VERFAELSCHT` <dbl>

what: Appendix: check for changes in previously collected data
title: Basic restatis Workflow
text: small additional step, like check one week later collected data objects updated last week. can also check additional interesting data objects interest/keyword added database. , need specify code objects looking time want look updates. want check something related updated, need use first part code sure covers topic interested . example, use “62361*” want check updated objects published specific statistic “Verdiensterhebung”. convenience, functions already implemented common date specifications, “week_before”, “month_before”, “year_before”. prefer fixed date, can enter string format “DD-MM-YYYY”. example, might want check see something new published collected cube object. use first part code “62361*“:
code: gen_modified_data(code = "62361", date = "week_before") #> Please note that this date is calculated automatically and may differ #>                 from manually entered data. Manually entered data must have #>                 the format DD.MM.YYYY. #> No modified objects found for your code and date.

what:
R Wrapper for the GENESIS Web Service RESTful API of the German
    Federal Statistical Office (Statistisches Bundesamt/Destatis)
title:
R Wrapper for the GENESIS Web Service RESTful API of the German
    Federal Statistical Office (Statistisches Bundesamt/Destatis)
text: restatis wrapper around RESTful API provides access GENESIS databases Federal Statistical Office Germany (Destatis).

title:
R Wrapper for the GENESIS Web Service RESTful API of the German
    Federal Statistical Office (Statistisches Bundesamt/Destatis)
text: can install released version restatis CRAN: install development version restatis GitHub :
code: install.packages("restatis") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("CorrelAid/restatis")

title:
R Wrapper for the GENESIS Web Service RESTful API of the German
    Federal Statistical Office (Statistisches Bundesamt/Destatis)
text: access Destatis GENESIS API, need account https://www-genesis.destatis.de store username password use R gen_auth_save() (see ?gen_auth_save details).

title:
R Wrapper for the GENESIS Web Service RESTful API of the German
    Federal Statistical Office (Statistisches Bundesamt/Destatis)
text: restatis provides functions (prefixed gen_) finding, exploring, retrieving data GENESIS API. See “Basic restatis workflow” vignette overview main features package.

title:
R Wrapper for the GENESIS Web Service RESTful API of the German
    Federal Statistical Office (Statistisches Bundesamt/Destatis)
text: restatis uses memoisation cache query results. means call function multiple times input, values returned first time stored reused second time. Cached objects stored memory persist across R sessions.

title:
R Wrapper for the GENESIS Web Service RESTful API of the German
    Federal Statistical Office (Statistisches Bundesamt/Destatis)
text: package way affiliated German Federal Statistical Office (Destatis). simple wrapper providing R functions access Destatis’ API. package authors way responsible data can retrieved using functions. license package solely applies source code.

what: gen_alternative_terms: Call for similiar or spelling related terms for further search — gen_alternative_terms
title: gen_alternative_terms: Call for similiar or spelling related terms for further search — gen_alternative_terms
text: Function find search terms similar related one another also represented Genesis.

title: gen_alternative_terms: Call for similiar or spelling related terms for further search — gen_alternative_terms
code: gen_alternative_terms(term = NULL, similarity = TRUE, ...)

title: gen_alternative_terms: Call for similiar or spelling related terms for further search — gen_alternative_terms
text: term Character string. Maximum length 15 characters. Term word searching alternative related terms. Use '*' placeholder possible generate broader search areas. similarity Logical. Indicator output function sorted based Levenshtein edit distance based adist() function. ... Additional parameters Genesis API call. parameters affecting Genesis call , processing.

title: gen_alternative_terms: Call for similiar or spelling related terms for further search — gen_alternative_terms
text: list recalled elements Genesis. Attributes added data.frame, describing search configuration returned output.

title: gen_alternative_terms: Call for similiar or spelling related terms for further search — gen_alternative_terms
code: if (FALSE) { # Find terms that are similar (in spelling) to search term "bus" # and sort them by Levenshtein edit distance object <- gen_alternative_terms(term = "bus", similarity = TRUE)  # Find terms that are related (in spelling) to search term "bus" object <- gen_alternative_terms(term = "bus*", similarity = TRUE) }

title: Save authentication — gen_auth_save
text: See Details.

title: Save authentication — gen_auth_save
code: gen_auth_save()

title: Save authentication — gen_auth_save
text: Genesis username password encrypted saved RDS package config directory. random string generated stored session environment variable RESTATIS_KEY. string used key encrypt decrypt entered Genesis credentials. avoid save authentication future sessions, RESTATIS_KEY can added .Renviron. usethis package includes helper function editing .Renviron files R session usethis::edit_r_environ().

what: catalogue: Explore Different Objects and Their Structural Embedding in Genesis — gen_catalogue
title: catalogue: Explore Different Objects and Their Structural Embedding in Genesis — gen_catalogue
text: Function enable searching tables, statistics, cubes Genesis. Additionally, structures output based internal tree structure Genesis based EVAS-numbers. Time-series represented cubes specified time span.

title: catalogue: Explore Different Objects and Their Structural Embedding in Genesis — gen_catalogue
code: gen_catalogue(   code = NULL,   category = c("tables", "statistics", "cubes"),   detailed = FALSE,   sortcriterion = c("code", "content"),   error.ignore = FALSE,   ... )

title: catalogue: Explore Different Objects and Their Structural Embedding in Genesis — gen_catalogue
text: code string maximum length 10 characters. Code Genesis-Object. one code per iteration. "*"-Notations possible. category string. Specific Genesis-Object-types: 'tables', 'statistics', 'cubes'. three together possible. detailed logical. Indicator function return detailed output iteration including object-related information shortened output including code object title. sortcriterion string. Indicator output sorted 'code' 'content'. parameter Genesis API call . error.ignore logical. Indicator function stop error occurs object request found produce token response. ... Additional parameter Genesis API call. parameters affecting Genesis API call , processing.

title: catalogue: Explore Different Objects and Their Structural Embedding in Genesis — gen_catalogue
text: list recalled elements Genesis API. Based detailed-parameter contains less information, always includes code object, title, type object. done facilitate processing data. Attributes added dataframe describing search configuration returned output.

title: catalogue: Explore Different Objects and Their Structural Embedding in Genesis — gen_catalogue
code: if (FALSE) { # Scroll through Objects under the topic "12*" # which is "Bevölkerung" in Destatis from all categories and # with a detailed output object <- gen_catalogue(code = "12*", detailed = T)  # Search tables under the topic "12*" which is "Bevölkerung" # without a detailed output object <- gen_catalogue(code = "12*", category = "tables") }

title: gen_cube — gen_cube
text: Download cube data Genesis

title: gen_cube — gen_cube
code: gen_cube(name, ...)

title: gen_cube — gen_cube
text: name Name data cube ... Optional parameters passed Genesis API call: area string. area table stored. Possible values: "public": cube public catalogue "user": cube user's account values logical. values included? metadata logical. metadata included? additionals logical. additional metadata included? contents string. Names required statistical specifications startyear,endyear number. retrieve data years. timeslices number. Number timeslices (cumulative startyear endyear) regionalvariable character. Code regional variable whose value specified regionalkey filter results. regionalkey character. One regional keys. Multiple values can supplied character vector single string, regional keys separated commas. Use wildcard (*) allowed. classifyingvariable1,classifyingvariable2       ,classifyingvariable3 character. Code subject classification (SK-Merkmal) selection means corresponding classifyingkey parameter applied. classifyingkey1,classifyingkey2,classifyingkey3 character. One values subject classification (e.g. "WZ93012"). Applied corresponding classifyingvariable parameter. Multiple keys can supplied character vector single string, keys separated commas. Use wildcard (*) allowed. stand string "DD.MM.YYYY". retrieve data updated #' date. language Search terms, returned messages data descriptions German ("de") English ("en")?

title: gen_cube — gen_cube
code: if (FALSE) { gen_cube("47414BJ002") }

title: gen_find — gen_find
text: Function search Genesis. similar usage search function Destatis main page (https://www.destatis.de/DE/Home/_inhalt.html). search query, "UND" (german word : ; can also written "und" "&") well "ODER" (german word : ; can also written "oder" "|") can included logically combined. Furthermore, wildcards possible including "*". one word included term-string, automatically "" used combine different words. Important note: Time-series treated cubes, longer distinguished. want find specific object clear code find function, need specify object type search object types.

title: gen_find — gen_find
code: gen_find(   term = NULL,   category = c("all", "tables", "statistics", "variables", "cubes"),   detailed = FALSE,   ordering = TRUE,   error.ignore = FALSE,   ... )

title: gen_find — gen_find
text: term string maximum character length, word limit five words. category string. Specific object types: 'tables', 'statistics', 'variables', 'cubes'. Using together possible. Default option '' objects. detailed logical. Indicator function return detailed output iteration including object related information shortened output including code object title. Default Option FALSE. ordering logical. Indicator function return output iteration ordered first based fact searched term appearing title object secondly estimator number variables object. Default option TRUE. error.ignore logical. Indicator function stop error occurs object request found produce artificial response (e.g., complex processes fail). ... Additional parameters Genesis API call. parameters affecting Genesis API call , processing.

title: gen_find — gen_find
text: list elements retrieved Genesis. Attributes added data.frame describing search configuration returned output.

title: gen_find — gen_find
code: if (FALSE) { # Find objects related to "bus" in Genesis object <- gen_find(term = "bus")  # Find tables related to "bus" in Genesis and return a unordered detailed output object <- gen_find(term = "bus", detailed = TRUE, ordering = FALSE)  # Find tables related to "Autos" or "Corona" in Genesis and return a unordered detailed output object <- gen_find(term = "autos ODER corona", detailed = TRUE, ordering = FALSE)  #' # Find tables related to "Autos" and "Corona" in Genesis and return a unordered detailed output object <- gen_find(term = "autos UND corona", detailed = TRUE, ordering = FALSE) }

what: gen_modified_data: Explore New Added Objects or Changed Objects in Genesis — gen_modified_data
title: gen_modified_data: Explore New Added Objects or Changed Objects in Genesis — gen_modified_data
text: Function check updates, changes, new objects Genesis based specific date.

title: gen_modified_data: Explore New Added Objects or Changed Objects in Genesis — gen_modified_data
code: gen_modified_data(   code = "",   type = c("all", "tables", "statistics", "statisticsUpdates"),   date = c("now", "week_before", "month_before", "year_before"),   ... )

title: gen_modified_data: Explore New Added Objects or Changed Objects in Genesis — gen_modified_data
text: code string maximum length 15 characters. Code Genesis object. one code per iteration. "*" notations possible. Empty code (default value) includes changes, updates, new added objects. type string. Specific Genesis object type: 'tables', 'statistics', 'statisticsUpdates'. three can accessed "", default. date string. Specific date used last update upload time Genesis include Genesis object return. Default option 'now', uses current date system. Alternative options 'week_before', using current date system minus 7 days, 'month_before', using current date system minus 4 weeks, 'year_before', using current date system minus 52 weeks. Additionally, possible fill specific date format 'DD.MM.YYYY'. ... Additional parameters Genesis call. parameters affecting Genesis call , processing.

title: gen_modified_data: Explore New Added Objects or Changed Objects in Genesis — gen_modified_data
text: list recalled elements Genesis. Always includes code object, title, type object. done facilitate processing data. Attributes added data.frame describing search configuration returned output.

title: gen_modified_data: Explore New Added Objects or Changed Objects in Genesis — gen_modified_data
code: if (FALSE) { # Find objects which were modified last_week object <- gen_modified_data(date = "week_before")  # Find tables that were new from 31.03.2020 object <- gen_modified_data(type = "tables", date = "31.03.2020")  # Find objects related to the topic "Bevölkerung" (Code: '12*') which were new today object <- gen_modified_data(code = "12*") }

title: gen_table — gen_table
text: Download table data Genesis

title: gen_table — gen_table
code: gen_table(name, ...)

title: gen_table — gen_table
text: name string. Name table. Use wildcards (*) allowed. ... Optional parameters passed Genesis API call: area string. area table stored. Possible values: "public": table public catalogue "user": table user's account compress logical. empty rows columns discarded? transpose logical. Reshape table "wide" "long" format. startyear,endyear number. retrieve data years. regionalvariable character. Code regional variable whose value specified regionalkey filter results. regionalkey character. One regional keys. Multiple values can supplied character vector single string, regional keys separated commas. Use wildcard (*) allowed. classifyingvariable1,classifyingvariable2       ,classifyingvariable3 character. Code subject classification (SK-Merkmal) selection means corresponding classifyingkey parameter applied. classifyingkey1,classifyingkey2,classifyingkey3 character. One values subject classification (e.g. "WZ93012"). Applied corresponding classifyingvariable parameter. Multiple keys can supplied character vector single string, keys separated commas. Use wildcard (*) allowed. stand string "DD.MM.YYYY". retrieve data updated #' date. language Search terms, returned messages data descriptions German ("de") English ("en")?

title: gen_table — gen_table
code: if (FALSE) { gen_table("21311-0001") }
